Hi,

I would like to integrate validation of XML files in JUnit Tests.

It =
would be cool to just point to a directory of xml files, provide a schema a=
nd then have for each schema a testcase generated, with one method for each=
 xml instance file.

Something like this:
- car.xsd
--- gm.xml (assertion f=
ailed: attribute missing bla bla)
--- toyota.xml (ok)
- opera.rng
--- der_r=
ing_des_nibelungen.xml (ok)
--- la_traviata.xml (ok)

This would allow for =
a comprehensive and compact display of the validation, e.g. in eclipse or o=
n a test-server, performing daily unit tests and producing output in a well=
-known fashion.

Google does not seem to help much. Does someone know of su=
ch a tool?

All the best,
Murat
